title: PCl5 equil. - which statement about Kp is correct

content.description:
Refer to the following.

PCl5(g) â‡„ PCl3(g)+Cl2(g)

PCl5(g) decomposes into PCl3(g) and Cl2(g) according to the equation above. A pure sample of PCl5(g) is placed in a rigid, evacuated 1.00L container. The initial pressure of the PCl5(g) is 1.00 atm. The temperature is held constant until the PCl5(g) reaches equilibrium with its decomposition products. The figures below show the initial and equilibrium conditions of the system.
content.question: Which of the following statements about Kp, the equilibrium constant for the reaction, is correct?

choices.label: It cannot be determined whether Kp > 1, Kp < 1, or Kp = 1 without additional information.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
